intro: Licaria reitzkleiniana, commonly known as the Reitzklein's licaria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
